Prihaja sprememba, ki vam bo prihranila čas, nekaterim tudi denar
Novost bo prinesla poenostavitve postopkov in prihranke.
05 Nov 2019, 07:19 by A. L.
LJUBLJANA – Predvidoma od 1. februarja 2020 bomo v Sloveniji papirnate bolniške liste (papirna potrdila o upravičeni zadržanosti od dela) zamenjali z elektronskim, ki se jim bo reklo eBOL. To pomeni, da vam zdravnik ob zaključku bolniškega staleža ne bo več dal potrdila o upravičeni zadržanosti od dela, ki ga je danes še vedno treba dostaviti delodajalcu, medtem ko bo ta do eBOL-ov svojih zapolenih lahko dostopal prek spletnega portala SPOT (eVEM). Z ministrstva za javno upravo so sporočili, da bo posodobitev delodajalcem prinesla tudi poenostavitev oddaje zahtevkov za refundacijo nadomestila plače na ZZZS: »Vlogo za oddajo zahtevka za refundacijo nadomestila lahko delodajalec odda elektronsko prek portala SPOT (eVEM) ali na podlagi pisne vloge. Pri tem je pomembno, da k vlogi po novem ne bo treba več prilagati originala ali skeniranega bolniškega lista. Delodajalcu ne bo treba čakati, da mu bo delavec dostavil bolniški list, temveč bo tekoče seznanjen z izdanimi eBOL in jih bo lahko sam prevzel kadar koli in tudi morebiti že pripravil zahtevek za refundacijo.« Novost bo prinesla poenostavitve postopkov in prihranke pri izvajalcih zdravstvene dejavnosti, osebnih zdravnikih, ki so pooblaščeni za izdajo 'zelenega' BOL, zavarovancih, delodajalcih, finančni upravi (Furs), Nacionalnem inštitutu za javno zdravje (NIJZ) in ZZZS, saj trenutna izdaja bolniških listov v papirni obliki pomeni administrativno oviro za vse naštete subjekte.
text:
A change is coming that will save you time, and some money, too
The novelty will bring simplification of procedures and savings.
05 Nov 2019, 07:19 by A.L.
LJUBLJANA - As of February 1, 2020, paper sick leaves (paper certificates of legitimate work retention) in Slovenia will be replaced with an electronic one, called eBOL. This means that at the end of your sick leave, your doctor will no longer give you a certificate of justified retention from work still required to be delivered to the employer today, while the employee will be able to access the eBOLs of his employees through the SPOT (eVEM) web portal . The Ministry of Public Administration said that the update will also bring to the employer the simplification of the submission of claims for salary reimbursement to the HIIS: "An application for the submission of a claim for compensation may be submitted by the employer electronically via the SPOT portal (eVEM) or by written application. In doing so, it is important that the original or the scanned patient sheet no longer need to be re-attached to the application. The employer will not have to wait for the employee to provide him or her with a sickness certificate, but will be familiar with eBOLs issued at any time and will be able to pick them up at any time and possibly prepare a claim for reimbursement. , personal physicians authorized to issue 'green' BOL, insureds, employers, financial administration (Furs), National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) and ZZZS, as the current paper-based issue of sick leaves constitutes an administrative obstacle for all of these entities .
